pages.text: These machines process materials, usually by the use of energy, to convert materials from one type to another.
The $(item)Nuclear Furnace$() quickly smelts items, using uranium ingots or dust as fuel.
The $(item)Manufactory$() is a machine that has many uses, mainly in processing materials.
The $(item)Separator$() separates materials into their constituent parts.
The $(item)Decay Hastener$() forces radioactive materials to decay, resulting in the formation of a different isotope or material. Radiation is released during the decay process.
The $(item)Fuel Reprocessor$() extracts materials from depleted fuel, allowing for the isolation of useful material from depleted fuel.
The $(item)Alloy Furnace$() combines base metals together into alloys.
The $(item)Fluid Infuser$() adds fluids to materials.
The $(item)Melter$() melts down materials into a liquid form.
The $(item)Supercooler$() lowers the temperature of fluids.
The $(item)Electrolyzer$() splits fluids into their constituent parts.
The $(item)Assembler$() combines components into a complex product.
The $(item)Ingot Former$() forms molten materials into ingots or gems.
The $(item)pressurizer$() processes materials under immense pressure.
The $(item)Chemical Reactor$() houses reactions between fluids, allowing for chemical reactions to occur.
The $(item)Fluid Mixer$() mixes fluids together.
The $(item)Crystallizer$() precipitates solids from a fluid.
The $(item)Fluid Enricher$() adds materials to fluids.
The $(item)Fluid Extractor$() extracts fluids from materials.
The $(item)Centrifuge$() separates isotopes out of fluid materials.
The $(item)Rock Crusher$() crushes rocks to produce mineral dusts.
